intro: Astragalus piscator, commonly known as water milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to drought conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife. Astragalus piscator is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
